website_summaries.verdict: The Brooks Caldera is a neutral shoe designed for trail running. Though it is sold at an expensive price, it delivers a great combination of flexibility, durability, and stability. With high-energy returning design, the shoe will not disappoint when used in long runs or daily trainings.
pros: The Caldera is comfortable and lightweight, according to some reviews
More than a few runners noted the good arch support of the shoe
Many were satisfied with the shoe’s traction on varied surfaces
Some runners liked the cushioning and supportive feature of the shoe
The double mesh upper remains breathable while preventing small debris from entering the shoe
The heel counter provides a secure and comfortable heel lock-down, as noted in some reviews
The well-ventilated upper is also quick-drying, as reported by a handful of expert reviewers
More than a good number of runners considered the Caldera as the best trail shoe from Brooks
It has ample trail-specific protection for ultra runs without compromising weight
cons: Few runners noticed that the outsole is not durable
A handful of female runners mentioned that it looks clunky

customer_reviews.title: Very Good All Around Trail Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great all around trail shoe for Ultras. Not great at any one thing- but very good for all around use. Comfy and supportive- but not for technical use or fast races . Used them for 50 K up to 100 milers. I own 3 pairs and they are my go to shoe for long ultra distances on tame trails.

product_meta.title: Brooks Men's Caldera Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Here is the Brooks model for walking. Brooks Caldera for men. Maximum cushioning has been added to the design of this model. Brooks Caldera guarantee an optimal cushioned and flexible shoe, offering an optimum energetic and stable bounce, just what you need for running on unstable terrain and trails. This model is equipped with many surprises, such as its fitted leggings on the back. With regard to its cushioned sole, there are two differences in its construction: a first layer made by DNA, which adapts to every part of the step, and a second layer which aims to protect and provide stability in every footstep. Lastly, it has a protective mesh top, which provides flexibility with a soft and seamless feel. Despite this increased height, which you can see at a glance on the front, the shoe has a drop of 4 mm so it offers good stability on all types of terrain. It should be noted that thanks to its thickness in the front, the Brooks Caldera is a shoe suitable for use in long distances. Another characteristic is its wider tongue, which prevents the entry of loose material into the inside of the shoe and they have a special section for storing the laces to avoid getting entangled in any shrubs or branches. Weight: 280g.
